comment: I took Dr. Xie for IT Capstone which in short is a semester long project. Dr. Xie was supportive, always available, and gave constructive feedback throughout the semester. His attitude and encouragement is exactly what students need to be successful upon graduation. Highly recommended!

I really enjoyed Practical Data Analytics with him! There is a lot of work, and not all of it is easy, but Dr. Xie will always go the extra mile (like answering emails at 11:30 PM) to make sure you know what to do. Super nice dude & I wish he taught more classes! I learned about machine learning in this class and my programming became better. 10/10

Really liked him for IT 6773! This class SHOULD be called "Intro to Machine Learning". Only reason this rating is not 5/5 is because few times in class, there was stuff that he did not talk about that he expected us to know for the homeworks. Other than that, he's super caring and really wants you to understand. Lots of work, but you learn a LOT.

Grades: 5 HW's, 3 online quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final, 1 group project. HW & midterm are tricky/time-consuming, but not too difficult. He gives 100's on them as long as you follow instructions. Quizzes are HARD but only 10% of grade. I failed 1 of them but still got an A. Group project is a 100 as long as you do it (takes LOTS of time). Easy final.

Dr. Xie is one of the most caring Professors I ever had through our my Student journey, & I'll take him again. I had Machine Learning course with him, & it was taught for the 1st time at KSU. Hence it was difficult. Dr. Xie had to tailor the lectures, & we had to do group studying & learn other online videos on the topics to get full understanding.

Decent class. Hybrid Database Admin course. The class would have been better if we met for 2.5 hours/week instead of just 1.25 hours a week because we often ran out of time and had to speed thru the slides. He's friendly and easy to understand.
Overall a good professor. Knows the material and is willing to help. Labs are easy and count for a large part of your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Excellent professor. Provides real world application of "Big Data" topics. Assignments allow the students to pursue areas of interest that are related to the course, while still learning the core concepts.  Would definitely take another course from him.

He cares about the subject he teaches and is well knowledge in it. If you have trouble with the subject then you can always ask him. He has trouble grading assignments on time, but is lenient on the grading. He wants the students to understand the materials than care too much on the grading.

Very caring about his students and wants everyone to learn. He records his lectures so if you miss a class you have options. Midterm was not difficult. Data mining class is divided into 2 tests, hw, and attendance is used to decide if you get curved or not.

CS6010 Advanced Algorithms course.  Interesting and up-to-date. Learned Hadoop, MapReduce. Java a must. Dr. Xie is very fair and flexible, gives you extra time if needed. No surprise info on tests, preps you beforehand. Pronunciation challenges but understandable. Efforts rewarded well. Would recommend for any course!
Great instructor. Wants students to learn not memorize. He doesn't care grades or timing.

CS7680 is a graduate advanced topics course.  Took weeks to create an objective that fit within the summer semester.  Gave weekly updates. Self-driven course.  Must know programming & create something. Xie was considerate, understanding and helpful and put focus on effort not grades.  Has some language challenges in pronunciation.
Awesome...easy A...very helpful professor. Would take him again.Again EASY A.

Good professor. He walks you through the steps needed to do the homework and project. His tests were online and multiple choice. If you missed a question you could retry it for partial credit. My only complaint was that his slides were pretty bare boned in terms of useful information. This class isn't offered very often but definitely worth taking.

Professor Xie is a great professor.  He communicates the knowledge that his has in a way that allows his class to learn the material and retain the information well.  Programming is not the easiest subject, but Xie made it and explained it in a learnable way

An excellent professor. Though I had difficulty at times understanding his accent, it's clear he's VERY knowledgeable in his field. He did an exceptional job engaging me intellectually despite my prior knowledge of the subject (I've been programming since age 10.) Xie ensures all students understand. I look forward to more of his classes.

He really knew what he was talking about. He allows a cheat sheet on tests. Is extremely available, and answers all his emails in a timely manner. I would recommend him to anyone. The only way you're going to fail this class is if you don't show up and you don't try.
Really like this professor. Really helpful. I would recommend him for any CS classes. Class is easy and he lets you use cheat sheet on the test and his tests are pretty easy too.

Dr. Xie is a great professor. KSU made these classes longer so lecture was a bit tedious while requiring attendance, but records lectures and puts them online so you can review them on your own pace later

Dr. Xie really knows his material! He helps anyone who asks for it, and makes sure that everyone understands the material! JAVA is the language used, and he gives tests that reflect things directly from the notes. He posts all of his notes and powerpoints online so that you can review them. Overall, he is a great professor that knows his material!
Data Base Master. Data Warehousing class was great but mixed regular students with grad student taking time from udergrads.  Wealth of kowledge is great. Extremely helpful. The Guy to go to!

What can I say about Ying... had him for CSIS2302 great teacher, took him for this class.  C++ is the language used so if you don't know it, learn some of it before taking the class or know JAVA well.  Builds on the assignments through the semester. Gives extra credit and 'pop-quiz' although all test are open book/notes. Fun teacher. A++

The class is very laid back which is why some students didn't do so well, he goes very slow and enjoys answering your questions. His test are right from his lectures and he tells you exactly what will be on the test and allows complete open notes, so noone really studied for the test which is why the did poorly. unbeilivible that someone failed it.

He knows his stuff. Started off a little slow with just doing power point and no hands on stuff. But he started doing that, and his class was very good! He wants you to do well! Great professor and nice person. It was his first class taught, I only expect him to get better.
